[https://products.office.com/en-us/CMSImages/Office365Logo_Orange.png?version=b8d100a9-0a8b-8e6a-88e1-ef488fee0470]
Your message to jhalstead-wiggins@ssdhvac.com couldn't be delivered.
jhalstead-wiggins@ssdhvac.com only accepts messages from people in its organization or on its allowed senders list, and your email address isn't on the list.
lori.maynard    Office 365      jhalstead-wiggins
Sender          Action Required
Sender not allowed

How to Fix It
It appears you aren't in the same organization as the recipient or your email address isn't on their allowed senders list. Contact the person you're sending your message to (by phone, for example) and tell them to ask their email admin to change the settings on their mailbox so it will accept messages from you.

Was this helpful? Send feedback to Microsoft<https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=615008>.
________________________________

More Info for Email Admins
Status code: 550 5.7.134

This error occurs when the recipient (an Office 365 mailbox) is configured to accept messages only from authenticated senders (senders in the same organization or those added to the recipient's allowed senders list).

To fix the issue, the recipient's email admin must add the sender's email address to the mailbox's allowed senders list, or they must turn off the mailbox's message delivery restrictions setting that requires that all senders to it are authenticated.

This issue can only be fixed by the recipient's email admin.

For more information and steps to fix this issue, see Fix email delivery issues for error code 5.7.134 in Office 365<https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=615128>.

> longer than expected. The bank keeps telling us the issue is still pending,

> it’s best for us to receive payments through our other active accounts.

>
> Janet dear,
>
> Let me start by saying that we always aim to close out our November books
> before moving into December. Madelin and I were accustomed to receiving
> invoices daily, and maintaining that flow is important. As you know, we do *a
> lot* of business, and it isn’t feasible for Madelin to pull these
> manually from your site every day. One-off situations are fine, of course,
> but from my understanding, the daily invoices stopped coming toward the end
> of November.
>
> I need two things:
>
>    1. *Confirmation that we can resume receiving all invoices on a daily
>    basis.*
>    2. *For today, please assign someone to Madelin so that all November
>    invoices can be sent to us this morning.* I cannot close out November
>    without having these entered. I’m fine waiting until the end of the week
>    for any missing December invoices, but November is urgent.
>
> We are still authorized for the payment I mentioned last week, and I will
> make that a priority—just as you’re making this request a priority for us.
> I truly appreciate everything you do. I know you work hard to keep us off
> hold, and I promise that once we get through the year-end, I’ll be back on
> fire with payments.
>
> Call me if you need anything. I’ll step out of any meeting for you.

On Wed, Dec 10, 2025 at 12:13 PM Janet Halstead- Wiggins <jhalstead-wiggins@ssdhvca.com<mailto:jhalstead-wiggins@ssdhvca.com>> wrote:
Good afternoon Lori,

We’re aware of the issue with the large batch and we’re already looking into a smoother, more efficient way to handle the invoice flow on our end. In the meantime, we’re making a few internal adjustments to prevent this from happening again. I’ll keep you updated as things progress.

Regarding sending the payment by check, there’s a short answer and a long answer. The short answer is unfortunately, we can’t accept the check.

The longer answer is that the account issues on our end are taking much longer than expected. The bank keeps telling us the issue is still pending, and we can’t pause business while they sort it out. That’s why, for now, it’s best for us to receive payments through our other active accounts. Trust me, it would be much easier for us too if we could just use our PayNow as usual, but this is the safest and most stable option at the moment.

To make things even easier and if it helps you feel more comfortable, I will share our primary internal account details. This is our main payroll general operating account, not the CITI. It’s the account we use daily, so it’s fully active and secure for receiving payments.

Rest assured, everything is safe on our end, and once the bank resolves the issue, we’ll go back to our normal process. But for now, this is the smoothest and most reliable route.


Regards,

Janet dear,

Let me start by saying that we always aim to close out our November books before moving into December. Madelin and I were accustomed to receiving invoices daily, and maintaining that flow is important. As you know, we do a lot of business, and it isn’t feasible for Madelin to pull these manually from your site every day. One-off situations are fine, of course, but from my understanding, the daily invoices stopped coming toward the end of November.

I need two things:

  1.  Confirmation that we can resume receiving all invoices on a daily basis.
  2.  For today, please assign someone to Madelin so that all November invoices can be sent to us this morning. I cannot close out November without having these entered. I’m fine waiting until the end of the week for any missing December invoices, but November is urgent.

We are still authorized for the payment I mentioned last week, and I will make that a priority—just as you’re making this request a priority for us. I truly appreciate everything you do. I know you work hard to keep us off hold, and I promise that once we get through the year-end, I’ll be back on fire with payments.

Call me if you need anything. I’ll step out of any meeting for you.

Hi Lori.

I hope that you are doing well & looking forward to the holidays!


Please take a moment to review your open accounts with Standard Supply.

This is a Pre Lien Reminder informing you that the following accounts require full payment clearing anything which is past due on or before December 10th, 2025.

[cid:image001.png@01DC5E22.CD2B53A0]
Please take a moment to review the updates below:

*******************************COMPANY UPDATE*****************************

New Online Payment Option: PayNOW — Fast, Secure, and Convenient

 

[https://files.constantcontact.com/6eb40698001/e8f4dda1-f9ea-4625-88f8-c59f43666504.jpg?rdr=true]

 

 
Dear Valued Customer,

For your convenience and continued service value, Standard Supply is pleased to announce the launch of our new PayNOW Online Payment Network, effective November 24, 2025.

You can access PayNOW by visiting our website at www.ssdhvac.com<http://www.ssdhvac.com/> and clicking the “PayNOW” button/icon. All you need is your SSD Account Number. Paying online is fast, secure, and available 24/7 from your smartphone, tablet, or computer — giving you complete flexibility in managing your account and invoices.



Payment Options Available:

You will have three (3) electronic payment options to choose from when paying your invoices:


  1.  ACH/eCheck (electronic check)
  2.  Debit Card
  3.  Credit Card

No Fee Options: There is no additional fee when paying by ACH/eCheck or Debit Card.

Credit Card Surcharge: Beginning November 24, 2025, a 3.00% surcharge will apply to all credit card payments. This surcharge helps offset the rising processing costs set by Visa, MasterCard, Discover, and American Express, allowing us to keep overall costs low for all customers.

If you’d like to avoid the surcharge, simply select ACH/eCheck or Debit Card when making your payment through PayNOW.



Why You’ll Love PayNOW


  *   Pay anytime, anywhere — no need to mail checks or call the office.
  *   Instant confirmation and faster payment posting.
  *   Simplified recordkeeping with digital receipts.
  *   Secure transactions using encrypted, bank-grade technology.

With PayNOW, you can eliminate the time and cost of sending paper checks or managing traditional bank ACH payments — all while enjoying a smoother, more efficient billing experience.



Questions?

We’re here to help! Please contact Rick De La Fuente at 214-379-6847 or rdelafuente@ssdhvac.com<mailto:rdelafuente@ssdhvac.com> with any questions about PayNOW or payment options.

Thank you for your continued partnership. We look forward to delivering even greater convenience and value as your trusted distributor of choice.



Kind regards,

Rick De La Fuente
Controller
rdelafuente@ssdhvac.com<mailto:rdelafuente@ssdhvac.com>

 

 

Regards,

Janet Halstead-Wiggins - CBA

How is my dear friend,

I haven’t spoken to you all week.  Hope all is well.
When you have a moment, please review the company update below:

*******************************COMPANY UPDATE*****************************

New Online Payment Option: PayNOW — Fast, Secure, and Convenient

 

[https://files.constantcontact.com/6eb40698001/e8f4dda1-f9ea-4625-88f8-c59f43666504.jpg?rdr=true]

 

 
Dear Valued Customer,

For your convenience and continued service value, Standard Supply is pleased to announce the launch of our new PayNOW Online Payment Network, effective November 24, 2025.

You can access PayNOW by visiting our website at www.ssdhvac.com<http://www.ssdhvac.com/> and clicking the “PayNOW” button/icon. All you need is your SSD Account Number. Paying online is fast, secure, and available 24/7 from your smartphone, tablet, or computer — giving you complete flexibility in managing your account and invoices.



Payment Options Available:

You will have three (3) electronic payment options to choose from when paying your invoices:


  1.  ACH/eCheck (electronic check)
  2.  Debit Card
  3.  Credit Card

No Fee Options: There is no additional fee when paying by ACH/eCheck or Debit Card.

Credit Card Surcharge: Beginning November 24, 2025, a 3.00% surcharge will apply to all credit card payments. This surcharge helps offset the rising processing costs set by Visa, MasterCard, Discover, and American Express, allowing us to keep overall costs low for all customers.

If you’d like to avoid the surcharge, simply select ACH/eCheck or Debit Card when making your payment through PayNOW.



Why You’ll Love PayNOW


  *   Pay anytime, anywhere — no need to mail checks or call the office.
  *   Instant confirmation and faster payment posting.
  *   Simplified recordkeeping with digital receipts.
  *   Secure transactions using encrypted, bank-grade technology.

With PayNOW, you can eliminate the time and cost of sending paper checks or managing traditional bank ACH payments — all while enjoying a smoother, more efficient billing experience.



Questions?

We’re here to help! Please contact Rick De La Fuente at 214-379-6847 or rdelafuente@ssdhvac.com<mailto:rdelafuente@ssdhvac.com> with any questions about PayNOW or payment options.

Thank you for your continued partnership. We look forward to delivering even greater convenience and value as your trusted distributor of choice.



Kind regards,

Rick De La Fuente
Controller
rdelafuente@ssdhvac.com<mailto:rdelafuente@ssdhvac.com>

 

 

Regards,

Janet Halstead-Wiggins - CBA

Hey Scott,

payment confirmation and remit.

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: <postmaster@ssdhvac.com>
Date: Mon, Dec 15, 2025 at 4:43 PM
Subject: Undeliverable: Re: Moss Mechnical - Invoices
To: <lori.maynard@askmoss.com>


Your message to jhalstead-wiggins@ssdhvac.com couldn't be delivered.
jhalstead-wiggins@ssdhvac.com only accepts messages from people in its
organization or on its allowed senders list, and your email address isn't
on the list.
lori.maynard Office 365 jhalstead-wiggins
Sender *Action Required*
Sender not allowed

How to Fix It
It appears you aren't in the same organization as the recipient or your
email address isn't on their allowed senders list. Contact the person
you're sending your message to (by phone, for example) and tell them to ask
their email admin to change the settings on their mailbox so it will accept
messages from you.

*Was this helpful? Send feedback to Microsoft
<https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=615008>.*
------------------------------

More Info for Email Admins
*Status code: 550 5.7.134*

This error occurs when the recipient (an Office 365 mailbox) is configured
to accept messages only from authenticated senders (senders in the same
organization or those added to the recipient's allowed senders list).

To fix the issue, the recipient's email admin must add the sender's email
address to the mailbox's allowed senders list, or they must turn off the
mailbox's message delivery restrictions setting that requires that all
senders to it are authenticated.

This issue can only be fixed by the recipient's email admin.

For more information and steps to fix this issue, see Fix email delivery
issues for error code 5.7.134 in Office 365
<https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=615128>.

>

> We’re aware of the issue with the large batch and we’re already looking
> into a smoother, more efficient way to handle the invoice flow on our end.
> In the meantime, we’re making a few internal adjustments to prevent this
> from happening again. I’ll keep you updated as things progress.
>
>
>
> Regarding sending the payment by check, there’s a short answer and a long
> answer. The short answer is unfortunately, we can’t accept the check.
>
>
>
> The longer answer is that the account issues on our end are taking much
> longer than expected. The bank keeps telling us the issue is still pending,
> and we can’t pause business while they sort it out. That’s why, for now,
> it’s best for us to receive payments through our other active accounts.
> Trust me, it would be much easier for us too if we could just use our
> PayNow as usual, but this is the safest and most stable option at the
> moment.
>
>
>
> To make things even easier and if it helps you feel more comfortable, I
> will share our primary internal account details. This is our main payroll
> general operating account, not the CITI. It’s the account we use daily, so
> it’s fully active and secure for receiving payments.
>
>
>
> Rest assured, everything is safe on our end, and once the bank resolves
> the issue, we’ll go back to our normal process. But for now, this is the
> smoothest and most reliable route.

> Janet dear,
>
> Let me start by saying that we always aim to close out our November books
> before moving into December. Madelin and I were accustomed to receiving
> invoices daily, and maintaining that flow is important. As you know, we do *a
> lot* of business, and it isn’t feasible for Madelin to pull these
> manually from your site every day. One-off situations are fine, of course,
> but from my understanding, the daily invoices stopped coming toward the end
> of November.
>
> I need two things:
>
>    1. *Confirmation that we can resume receiving all invoices on a daily
>    basis.*
>    2. *For today, please assign someone to Madelin so that all November
>    invoices can be sent to us this morning.* I cannot close out November
>    without having these entered. I’m fine waiting until the end of the week
>    for any missing December invoices, but November is urgent.
>
> We are still authorized for the payment I mentioned last week, and I will
> make that a priority—just as you’re making this request a priority for us.
> I truly appreciate everything you do. I know you work hard to keep us off
> hold, and I promise that once we get through the year-end, I’ll be back on
> fire with payments.

EMAIL BODY

Hey team,

I just noticed that in November we were charged $5500 for late fees. Now I
am not going to sit here and argue that we are late. What I will say is
that we spend too much to be charged late fees. We know how the end of year
is. We are slow to get paid and we want to wait til next year to pay too!!!
Everyone in this industry is doing the same song and dance. I will ask that
you please remove that. Please let me know if that can be done. Thank you
both.

On Fri, Dec 12, 2025 at 4:07 PM Lori Maynard <lori.maynard@askmoss.com>
wrote:

> Janet I was just authorized for 200k. I will wait until Monday morning as
> it won't be processed until then at this point.

EMAIL BODY
============================================================
Robert and team,
(Robert, I got your email and will call you shortly. Will give you a few to read through this and digest.)

I will share with you the most current information I have shared with my team regarding the details surrounding this incident:

Team,

Moss Mechanical appears to have suffered a targeted email compromise and social engineering/spearphising attack. It appears that a threat actor may have been monitoring Moss Mechanical inboxes through an established presence foothold for communications related to payments. After identifying Standard Supply as a high-dollar ACH target for Moss, the threat actor established the domain SSDHVCA.COM
Using this domain and a mailbox they established for jhalstead-wiggins@ssdhvca.com, the threat actor copied Janet's incoming Standard Supply signature and impersonated her. They directed Moss Mechanical to wire $300,000 to a new ACH bank account ## @ CITI Bank.
(After investigation, it appears the threat actor may have been monitoring Moss mailboxes for an extended period and that a recent payment made 10/31/2025 for $300,800 was the amount flagged and targeted for extortion as the highest recent payment amount.)
Moss Mechanical pushed the ACH payment through, but fraud was determined before clearing, and they were able to stop the payment and claw the cash back. At this point the threat actor turned their sights on Standard Supply / Janet.

Yesterday (12/15/25), Janet came to IT as she got targeted by a spam campaign which was hitting her with  ~12 emails per minute. They came from domains across the globe in varying languages and with no consistent pattern.
In order to stop this, I restricted external senders ability to send to her mailbox for a few hours. The threat actor stopped their campaign against her mailbox and she is no longer being targeted.

After considering the attack pattern, this is the current apparent attack vector and progression surrounding this incident:
1) At least 1 Moss Mechanical user likely suffered a spam incident similar to what Janet received yesterday.
2) Someone at Moss fell prey to the campaign and the threat actor gained persistent access to their mailbox.
3) Threat actor monitored Moss communications to determine who they do business with, who do they send money to and who they send the largest sums of money to.
4) After identifying Standard Supply as a common business partner, the threat actor purchased SSDHVCA.COM on 12/4/2025, routed email services to it, and established a similar, false user in jhalstead-wiggins@ssdhvca.com.
5) Further monitoring email communications, the threat actor identified a time period when the real Janet was out-of-office, and inserted themselves into the communication chain during that time. Exacerbating the issue appears to be that Lori's department all fell ill to the flu during the same time span.
6) The threat actor submitted a request via email to have funds transmitted to a specified account.
7) After transmission confirmation was received, the threat actor immediately turned their sights on Standard Supply and engaged in a spam campaign against our users.

Regarding phone communications on 12/8/2025: Lori did indeed call Janet directly. They discussed a pending payment in the amount of ~$150,000, and settled legitimate business surrounding that transaction. Shortly thereafter, the threat actor requested the $300,000. It appears that the close proximity of these events on the timeline further increased the confusion at play. The AP team at Moss was also ill during this time which impeded internal communications on their team.
YOUR TEAM SHOULD BE ON THE CONTINUED LOOKOUT FOR FRAUDULENT EMAILS REQUESTING PAYMENT FROM MOSS MECHANICAL!!
Recommendations at this time:

  *
Terminate all user sessions across all devices and browsers - force reauthentication
  *
Rotate the email credentials for every mail user at Moss Mechanical
  *
Implement multi-factor authentication (MFA) for all email and corporate communication platforms. Utilize SSO if possible.
  *
Discuss internally and distribute information related to cybersecurity awareness for your team. Evaluate Security Awareness Training (SAT) platforms for ongoing training of individuals at your organization to be on the lookout for these threats.
  *
All mailboxes should reviewed for automatic forwarding rules
  *
Exchange mail-flow rules should be evaluated for any new rules put in place to obfuscate threat actor actions
  *
Optionally and as an enhanced security measure, ensure Sender Policy Framework (SPF), Domain Key Identified Mail (DKIM) and Domain Based Message Auth., Reporting and Conformance (DMARC) are in place to secure and verify email traffic related to your corporate domains.

Best,


⋋     Jason Muhlberger

Need help? Open a ticket!

Portal: IT Helpdesk<https://ssdhvac.sd.cloud.invgate.net/portal>

Email: help-it@ssdhvac.com<mailto:help-it@ssdhvac.com>

⋋     IT Services

⋋     Senior Administrator

        Standard Supply • Bartos Industries • coolCare Protection

*******************************COMPANY UPDATE*****************************

New Online Payment Option: PayNOW — Fast, Secure, and Convenient

 

[https://files.constantcontact.com/6eb40698001/e8f4dda1-f9ea-4625-88f8-c59f43666504.jpg?rdr=true]

 

 
Dear Valued Customer,

For your convenience and continued service value, Standard Supply is pleased to announce the launch of our new PayNOW Online Payment Network, effective November 24, 2025.

You can access PayNOW by visiting our website at www.ssdhvac.com<http://www.ssdhvac.com/> and clicking the “PayNOW” button/icon. All you need is your SSD Account Number. Paying online is fast, secure, and available 24/7 from your smartphone, tablet, or computer — giving you complete flexibility in managing your account and invoices.



Payment Options Available:

You will have three (3) electronic payment options to choose from when paying your invoices:


  1.  ACH/eCheck (electronic check)
  2.  Debit Card
  3.  Credit Card

No Fee Options: There is no additional fee when paying by ACH/eCheck or Debit Card.

Credit Card Surcharge: Beginning November 24, 2025, a 3.00% surcharge will apply to all credit card payments. This surcharge helps offset the rising processing costs set by Visa, MasterCard, Discover, and American Express, allowing us to keep overall costs low for all customers.

If you’d like to avoid the surcharge, simply select ACH/eCheck or Debit Card when making your payment through PayNOW.



Why You’ll Love PayNOW


  *   Pay anytime, anywhere — no need to mail checks or call the office.
  *   Instant confirmation and faster payment posting.
  *   Simplified recordkeeping with digital receipts.
  *   Secure transactions using encrypted, bank-grade technology.

With PayNOW, you can eliminate the time and cost of sending paper checks or managing traditional bank ACH payments — all while enjoying a smoother, more efficient billing experience.



Questions?

We’re here to help! Please contact Rick De La Fuente at 214-379-6847 or rdelafuente@ssdhvac.com<mailto:rdelafuente@ssdhvac.com> with any questions about PayNOW or payment options.

Thank you for your continued partnership. We look forward to delivering even greater convenience and value as your trusted distributor of choice.



Kind regards,

Rick De La Fuente
Controller
rdelafuente@ssdhvac.com<mailto:rdelafuente@ssdhvac.com>

Hello Madelin.


Please take a moment to review the attached statement pertaining to past due balances.



To make the process easier, you can use our new payment portal, PayNOW. The site can be accessed by clicking this link:

https://paynow-prod-eu2.gounified.com/qpay/ssdhvac




You'll just need your customer number, 125604 and an open invoice number, 10428624.



*******************************COMPANY UPDATE*****************************

New Online Payment Option: PayNOW — Fast, Secure, and Convenient

 

[https://files.constantcontact.com/6eb40698001/e8f4dda1-f9ea-4625-88f8-c59f43666504.jpg?rdr=true]

 

 
Dear Valued Customer,

For your convenience and continued service value, Standard Supply is pleased to announce the launch of our new PayNOW Online Payment Network, effective November 24, 2025.

You can access PayNOW by visiting our website at www.ssdhvac.com<http://www.ssdhvac.com/> and clicking the “PayNOW” button/icon. All you need is your SSD Account Number. Paying online is fast, secure, and available 24/7 from your smartphone, tablet, or computer — giving you complete flexibility in managing your account and invoices.



Payment Options Available:

You will have three (3) electronic payment options to choose from when paying your invoices:


  1.  ACH/eCheck (electronic check)
  2.  Debit Card
  3.  Credit Card

No Fee Options: There is no additional fee when paying by ACH/eCheck or Debit Card.

Credit Card Surcharge: Beginning November 24, 2025, a 3.00% surcharge will apply to all credit card payments. This surcharge helps offset the rising processing costs set by Visa, MasterCard, Discover, and American Express, allowing us to keep overall costs low for all customers.

If you’d like to avoid the surcharge, simply select ACH/eCheck or Debit Card when making your payment through PayNOW.



Why You’ll Love PayNOW


  *   Pay anytime, anywhere — no need to mail checks or call the office.
  *   Instant confirmation and faster payment posting.
  *   Simplified recordkeeping with digital receipts.
  *   Secure transactions using encrypted, bank-grade technology.

With PayNOW, you can eliminate the time and cost of sending paper checks or managing traditional bank ACH payments — all while enjoying a smoother, more efficient billing experience.



Questions?

We’re here to help! Please contact Rick De La Fuente at 214-379-6847 or rdelafuente@ssdhvac.com<mailto:rdelafuente@ssdhvac.com> with any questions about PayNOW or payment options.

Thank you for your continued partnership. We look forward to delivering even greater convenience and value as your trusted distributor of choice.



Kind regards,

Rick De La Fuente
Controller
rdelafuente@ssdhvac.com<mailto:rdelafuente@ssdhvac.com>

 

 

Regards,

Janet Halstead-Wiggins - CBA

Hi Lori.

I hope that you are doing well & looking forward to the holidays!


Please take a moment to review your open accounts with Standard Supply.

This is a Pre Lien Reminder informing you that the following accounts require full payment clearing anything which is past due on or before December 10th, 2025.

[cid:image001.png@01DC5E22.CD2B53A0]
Please take a moment to review the updates below:

*******************************COMPANY UPDATE*****************************

New Online Payment Option: PayNOW — Fast, Secure, and Convenient

 

[https://files.constantcontact.com/6eb40698001/e8f4dda1-f9ea-4625-88f8-c59f43666504.jpg?rdr=true]

 

 
Dear Valued Customer,

For your convenience and continued service value, Standard Supply is pleased to announce the launch of our new PayNOW Online Payment Network, effective November 24, 2025.

You can access PayNOW by visiting our website at www.ssdhvac.com<http://www.ssdhvac.com/> and clicking the “PayNOW” button/icon. All you need is your SSD Account Number. Paying online is fast, secure, and available 24/7 from your smartphone, tablet, or computer — giving you complete flexibility in managing your account and invoices.



Payment Options Available:

You will have three (3) electronic payment options to choose from when paying your invoices:


  1.  ACH/eCheck (electronic check)
  2.  Debit Card
  3.  Credit Card

No Fee Options: There is no additional fee when paying by ACH/eCheck or Debit Card.

Credit Card Surcharge: Beginning November 24, 2025, a 3.00% surcharge will apply to all credit card payments. This surcharge helps offset the rising processing costs set by Visa, MasterCard, Discover, and American Express, allowing us to keep overall costs low for all customers.

If you’d like to avoid the surcharge, simply select ACH/eCheck or Debit Card when making your payment through PayNOW.



Why You’ll Love PayNOW


  *   Pay anytime, anywhere — no need to mail checks or call the office.
  *   Instant confirmation and faster payment posting.
  *   Simplified recordkeeping with digital receipts.
  *   Secure transactions using encrypted, bank-grade technology.

With PayNOW, you can eliminate the time and cost of sending paper checks or managing traditional bank ACH payments — all while enjoying a smoother, more efficient billing experience.



Questions?

We’re here to help! Please contact Rick De La Fuente at 214-379-6847 or rdelafuente@ssdhvac.com<mailto:rdelafuente@ssdhvac.com> with any questions about PayNOW or payment options.

Thank you for your continued partnership. We look forward to delivering even greater convenience and value as your trusted distributor of choice.



Kind regards,

Rick De La Fuente
Controller
rdelafuente@ssdhvac.com<mailto:rdelafuente@ssdhvac.com>

*******************************COMPANY UPDATE*****************************

New Online Payment Option: PayNOW — Fast, Secure, and Convenient

 

[https://files.constantcontact.com/6eb40698001/e8f4dda1-f9ea-4625-88f8-c59f43666504.jpg?rdr=true]

 

 
Dear Valued Customer,

For your convenience and continued service value, Standard Supply is pleased to announce the launch of our new PayNOW Online Payment Network, effective November 24, 2025.

You can access PayNOW by visiting our website at www.ssdhvac.com<http://www.ssdhvac.com/> and clicking the “PayNOW” button/icon. All you need is your SSD Account Number. Paying online is fast, secure, and available 24/7 from your smartphone, tablet, or computer — giving you complete flexibility in managing your account and invoices.



Payment Options Available:

You will have three (3) electronic payment options to choose from when paying your invoices:


  1.  ACH/eCheck (electronic check)
  2.  Debit Card
  3.  Credit Card

No Fee Options: There is no additional fee when paying by ACH/eCheck or Debit Card.

Credit Card Surcharge: Beginning November 24, 2025, a 3.00% surcharge will apply to all credit card payments. This surcharge helps offset the rising processing costs set by Visa, MasterCard, Discover, and American Express, allowing us to keep overall costs low for all customers.

If you’d like to avoid the surcharge, simply select ACH/eCheck or Debit Card when making your payment through PayNOW.



Why You’ll Love PayNOW


  *   Pay anytime, anywhere — no need to mail checks or call the office.
  *   Instant confirmation and faster payment posting.
  *   Simplified recordkeeping with digital receipts.
  *   Secure transactions using encrypted, bank-grade technology.

With PayNOW, you can eliminate the time and cost of sending paper checks or managing traditional bank ACH payments — all while enjoying a smoother, more efficient billing experience.



Questions?

We’re here to help! Please contact Rick De La Fuente at 214-379-6847 or rdelafuente@ssdhvac.com<mailto:rdelafuente@ssdhvac.com> with any questions about PayNOW or payment options.

Thank you for your continued partnership. We look forward to delivering even greater convenience and value as your trusted distributor of choice.



Kind regards,

*******************************COMPANY UPDATE*****************************

New Online Payment Option: PayNOW — Fast, Secure, and Convenient

 

[https://files.constantcontact.com/6eb40698001/e8f4dda1-f9ea-4625-88f8-c59f43666504.jpg?rdr=true]

 

 
Dear Valued Customer,

For your convenience and continued service value, Standard Supply is pleased to announce the launch of our new PayNOW Online Payment Network, effective November 24, 2025.

You can access PayNOW by visiting our website at www.ssdhvac.com<http://www.ssdhvac.com/> and clicking the “PayNOW” button/icon. All you need is your SSD Account Number. Paying online is fast, secure, and available 24/7 from your smartphone, tablet, or computer — giving you complete flexibility in managing your account and invoices.



Payment Options Available:

You will have three (3) electronic payment options to choose from when paying your invoices:


  1.  ACH/eCheck (electronic check)
  2.  Debit Card
  3.  Credit Card

No Fee Options: There is no additional fee when paying by ACH/eCheck or Debit Card.

Credit Card Surcharge: Beginning November 24, 2025, a 3.00% surcharge will apply to all credit card payments. This surcharge helps offset the rising processing costs set by Visa, MasterCard, Discover, and American Express, allowing us to keep overall costs low for all customers.

If you’d like to avoid the surcharge, simply select ACH/eCheck or Debit Card when making your payment through PayNOW.



Why You’ll Love PayNOW


  *   Pay anytime, anywhere — no need to mail checks or call the office.
  *   Instant confirmation and faster payment posting.
  *   Simplified recordkeeping with digital receipts.
  *   Secure transactions using encrypted, bank-grade technology.

With PayNOW, you can eliminate the time and cost of sending paper checks or managing traditional bank ACH payments — all while enjoying a smoother, more efficient billing experience.



Questions?

We’re here to help! Please contact Rick De La Fuente at 214-379-6847 or rdelafuente@ssdhvac.com<mailto:rdelafuente@ssdhvac.com> with any questions about PayNOW or payment options.

Thank you for your continued partnership. We look forward to delivering even greater convenience and value as your trusted distributor of choice.



Kind regards,

Rick De La Fuente
Controller
rdelafuente@ssdhvac.com<mailto:rdelafuente@ssdhvac.com>

Janet Halstead-Wiggins - CBA

EMAIL BODY
============================================================
Janet dear,

Let me start by saying that we always aim to close out our November books
before moving into December. Madelin and I were accustomed to receiving
invoices daily, and maintaining that flow is important. As you know, we do *a
lot* of business, and it isn’t feasible for Madelin to pull these manually
from your site every day. One-off situations are fine, of course, but from
my understanding, the daily invoices stopped coming toward the end of
November.

I need two things:

   1.

   *Confirmation that we can resume receiving all invoices on a daily
   basis.*
   2.

   *For today, please assign someone to Madelin so that all November
   invoices can be sent to us this morning.* I cannot close out November
   without having these entered. I’m fine waiting until the end of the week
   for any missing December invoices, but November is urgent.

We are still authorized for the payment I mentioned last week, and I will
make that a priority—just as you’re making this request a priority for us.
I truly appreciate everything you do. I know you work hard to keep us off
hold, and I promise that once we get through the year-end, I’ll be back on
fire with payments.

Call me if you need anything. I’ll step out of any meeting for you.

>    2. Debit Card
>    3. Credit Card
>
>
>

> or* Debit Card*.
>
>
>
> *Credit Card Surcharge:* Beginning *November 24, 2025*, a *3.00%
> surcharge* will apply to all credit card payments. This surcharge helps
> offset the rising processing costs set by Visa, MasterCard, Discover, and
> American Express, allowing us to keep overall costs low for all customers.
>
>
>
> If you’d like to avoid the surcharge, simply select *ACH/eCheck or Debit
> Card *when making your payment through PayNOW.
>
>
>
>
>

>
>
>
>    - *Pay anytime, anywhere* — no need to mail checks or call the office.
>    - *Instant confirmation* and faster payment posting.
>    - *Simplified recordkeeping* with digital receipts.
>    - *Secure transactions* using encrypted, bank-grade technology.
>
>
>

[https://products.office.com/en-us/CMSImages/Office365Logo_Orange.png?version=b8d100a9-0a8b-8e6a-88e1-ef488fee0470]
Your message to jhalstead-wiggins@ssdhvac.com couldn't be delivered.
jhalstead-wiggins@ssdhvac.com only accepts messages from people in its organization or on its allowed senders list, and your email address isn't on the list.
lori.maynard    Office 365      jhalstead-wiggins
Sender          Action Required
Sender not allowed

How to Fix It
It appears you aren't in the same organization as the recipient or your email address isn't on their allowed senders list. Contact the person you're sending your message to (by phone, for example) and tell them to ask their email admin to change the settings on their mailbox so it will accept messages from you.

Was this helpful? Send feedback to Microsoft<https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=615008>.
________________________________

More Info for Email Admins
Status code: 550 5.7.134

This error occurs when the recipient (an Office 365 mailbox) is configured to accept messages only from authenticated senders (senders in the same organization or those added to the recipient's allowed senders list).

To fix the issue, the recipient's email admin must add the sender's email address to the mailbox's allowed senders list, or they must turn off the mailbox's message delivery restrictions setting that requires that all senders to it are authenticated.

This issue can only be fixed by the recipient's email admin.

For more information and steps to fix this issue, see Fix email delivery issues for error code 5.7.134 in Office 365<https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=615128>.

On Wed, Dec 10, 2025 at 12:13 PM Janet Halstead- Wiggins <jhalstead-wiggins@ssdhvca.com<mailto:jhalstead-wiggins@ssdhvca.com>> wrote:
Good afternoon Lori,

We’re aware of the issue with the large batch and we’re already looking into a smoother, more efficient way to handle the invoice flow on our end. In the meantime, we’re making a few internal adjustments to prevent this from happening again. I’ll keep you updated as things progress.

Regarding sending the payment by check, there’s a short answer and a long answer. The short answer is unfortunately, we can’t accept the check.

The longer answer is that the account issues on our end are taking much longer than expected. The bank keeps telling us the issue is still pending, and we can’t pause business while they sort it out. That’s why, for now, it’s best for us to receive payments through our other active accounts. Trust me, it would be much easier for us too if we could just use our PayNow as usual, but this is the safest and most stable option at the moment.

To make things even easier and if it helps you feel more comfortable, I will share our primary internal account details. This is our main payroll general operating account, not the CITI. It’s the account we use daily, so it’s fully active and secure for receiving payments.

Rest assured, everything is safe on our end, and once the bank resolves the issue, we’ll go back to our normal process. But for now, this is the smoothest and most reliable route.


Regards,



Janet Halstead-Wiggins - CBA

Janet dear,

Let me start by saying that we always aim to close out our November books before moving into December. Madelin and I were accustomed to receiving invoices daily, and maintaining that flow is important. As you know, we do a lot of business, and it isn’t feasible for Madelin to pull these manually from your site every day. One-off situations are fine, of course, but from my understanding, the daily invoices stopped coming toward the end of November.

I need two things:

  1.  Confirmation that we can resume receiving all invoices on a daily basis.

  2.  For today, please assign someone to Madelin so that all November invoices can be sent to us this morning. I cannot close out November without having these entered. I’m fine waiting until the end of the week for any missing December invoices, but November is urgent.

We are still authorized for the payment I mentioned last week, and I will make that a priority—just as you’re making this request a priority for us. I truly appreciate everything you do. I know you work hard to keep us off hold, and I promise that once we get through the year-end, I’ll be back on fire with payments.

Call me if you need anything. I’ll step out of any meeting for you.

We’re aware of the issue with the large batch and we’re already looking into a smoother, more efficient way to handle the invoice flow on our end. In the meantime, we’re making a few internal adjustments to prevent this from happening again. I’ll keep you updated as things progress.

The longer answer is that the account issues on our end are taking much longer than expected. The bank keeps telling us the issue is still pending, and we can’t pause business while they sort it out. That’s why, for now, it’s best for us to receive payments through our other active accounts. Trust me, it would be much easier for us too if we could just use our PayNow as usual, but this is the safest and most stable option at the moment.

To make things even easier and if it helps you feel more comfortable, I will share our primary internal account details. This is our main payroll general operating account, not the CITI. It’s the account we use daily, so it’s fully active and secure for receiving payments.

This forces Madelin to manually click through each one, and we simply do not have the bandwidth for that—especially with you being one of our major suppliers.

We really need a more efficient, smoother-running process. Please let me know what options we have to streamline this.

Thank you.

We’re aware of the issue with the large batch and we’re already looking into a smoother, more efficient way to handle the invoice flow on our end. In the meantime, we’re making a few internal adjustments to prevent this from happening again. I’ll keep you updated as things progress.

The longer answer is that the account issues on our end are taking much longer than expected. The bank keeps telling us the issue is still pending, and we can’t pause business while they sort it out. That’s why, for now, it’s best for us to receive payments through our other active accounts. Trust me, it would be much easier for us too if we could just use our PayNow as usual, but this is the safest and most stable option at the moment.

To make things even easier and if it helps you feel more comfortable, I will share our primary internal account details. This is our main payroll general operating account, not the CITI. It’s the account we use daily, so it’s fully active and secure for receiving payments.

Rest assured, everything is safe on our end, and once the bank resolves the issue, we’ll go back to our normal process. But for now, this is the smoothest and most reliable route.

Good afternoon Lori,

We’re aware of the issue with the large batch and we’re already looking into a smoother, more efficient way to handle the invoice flow on our end. In the meantime, we’re making a few internal adjustments to prevent this from happening again. I’ll keep you updated as things progress.

Regarding sending the payment by check, there’s a short answer and a long answer. The short answer is unfortunately, we can’t accept the check.

The longer answer is that the account issues on our end are taking much longer than expected. The bank keeps telling us the issue is still pending, and we can’t pause business while they sort it out. That’s why, for now, it’s best for us to receive payments through our other active accounts. Trust me, it would be much easier for us too if we could just use our PayNow as usual, but this is the safest and most stable option at the moment.

To make things even easier and if it helps you feel more comfortable, I will share our primary internal account details. This is our main payroll general operating account, not the CITI. It’s the account we use daily, so it’s fully active and secure for receiving payments.

Rest assured, everything is safe on our end, and once the bank resolves the issue, we’ll go back to our normal process. But for now, this is the smoothest and most reliable route.

I was actually about to reach out regarding invoices. Today we received 45 invoices at once, and the system is telling us that the batch is too large to run as a single invoice image. This forces Madelin to manually click through each one, and we simply do not have the bandwidth for that—especially with you being one of our major suppliers.

We really need a more efficient, smoother-running process. Please let me know what options we have to streamline this.

Thank you.

On Wed, Dec 10, 2025 at 12:13 PM Janet Halstead- Wiggins <jhalstead-wiggins@ssdhvca.com<mailto:jhalstead-wiggins@ssdhvca.com>> wrote:
Good afternoon Lori,

We’re aware of the issue with the large batch and we’re already looking into a smoother, more efficient way to handle the invoice flow on our end. In the meantime, we’re making a few internal adjustments to prevent this from happening again. I’ll keep you updated as things progress.

Regarding sending the payment by check, there’s a short answer and a long answer. The short answer is unfortunately, we can’t accept the check.

The longer answer is that the account issues on our end are taking much longer than expected. The bank keeps telling us the issue is still pending, and we can’t pause business while they sort it out. That’s why, for now, it’s best for us to receive payments through our other active accounts. Trust me, it would be much easier for us too if we could just use our PayNow as usual, but this is the safest and most stable option at the moment.

To make things even easier and if it helps you feel more comfortable, I will share our primary internal account details. This is our main payroll general operating account, not the CITI. It’s the account we use daily, so it’s fully active and secure for receiving payments.

Rest assured, everything is safe on our end, and once the bank resolves the issue, we’ll go back to our normal process. But for now, this is the smoothest and most reliable route.


Regards,



Janet Halstead-Wiggins - CBA

Janet dear,

Let me start by saying that we always aim to close out our November books before moving into December. Madelin and I were accustomed to receiving invoices daily, and maintaining that flow is important. As you know, we do a lot of business, and it isn’t feasible for Madelin to pull these manually from your site every day. One-off situations are fine, of course, but from my understanding, the daily invoices stopped coming toward the end of November.

I need two things:

  1.  Confirmation that we can resume receiving all invoices on a daily basis.

  2.  For today, please assign someone to Madelin so that all November invoices can be sent to us this morning. I cannot close out November without having these entered. I’m fine waiting until the end of the week for any missing December invoices, but November is urgent.

We are still authorized for the payment I mentioned last week, and I will make that a priority—just as you’re making this request a priority for us. I truly appreciate everything you do. I know you work hard to keep us off hold, and I promise that once we get through the year-end, I’ll be back on fire with payments.

Call me if you need anything. I’ll step out of any meeting for you.

Janet dear,

Let me start by saying that we always aim to close out our November books before moving into December. Madelin and I were accustomed to receiving invoices daily, and maintaining that flow is important. As you know, we do a lot of business, and it isn’t feasible for Madelin to pull these manually from your site every day. One-off situations are fine, of course, but from my understanding, the daily invoices stopped coming toward the end of November.

I need two things:

  1.  Confirmation that we can resume receiving all invoices on a daily basis.

  2.  For today, please assign someone to Madelin so that all November invoices can be sent to us this morning. I cannot close out November without having these entered. I’m fine waiting until the end of the week for any missing December invoices, but November is urgent.

We are still authorized for the payment I mentioned last week, and I will make that a priority—just as you’re making this request a priority for us. I truly appreciate everything you do. I know you work hard to keep us off hold, and I promise that once we get through the year-end, I’ll be back on fire with payments.

Call me if you need anything. I’ll step out of any meeting for you.

Ohhhh Janet, that sounds awful.

Just to be clear — you’re saying it’s best for us to send the ACH directly from my bank to yours using the information you provided, correct? And once we send that ACH, we will then send you and your team our remittance along with the receipt from our bank?

On Wed, Dec 10, 2025 at 12:13 PM Janet Halstead- Wiggins <jhalstead-wiggins@ssdhvca.com<mailto:jhalstead-wiggins@ssdhvca.com>> wrote:
Good afternoon Lori,

We’re aware of the issue with the large batch and we’re already looking into a smoother, more efficient way to handle the invoice flow on our end. In the meantime, we’re making a few internal adjustments to prevent this from happening again. I’ll keep you updated as things progress.

Regarding sending the payment by check, there’s a short answer and a long answer. The short answer is unfortunately, we can’t accept the check.

The longer answer is that the account issues on our end are taking much longer than expected. The bank keeps telling us the issue is still pending, and we can’t pause business while they sort it out. That’s why, for now, it’s best for us to receive payments through our other active accounts. Trust me, it would be much easier for us too if we could just use our PayNow as usual, but this is the safest and most stable option at the moment.

To make things even easier and if it helps you feel more comfortable, I will share our primary internal account details. This is our main payroll general operating account, not the CITI. It’s the account we use daily, so it’s fully active and secure for receiving payments.

Rest assured, everything is safe on our end, and once the bank resolves the issue, we’ll go back to our normal process. But for now, this is the smoothest and most reliable route.


Regards,



Janet Halstead-Wiggins - CBA

Senior Credit Manager

NACM MEMBER

Good afternoon Lori,

We’re aware of the issue with the large batch and we’re already looking into a smoother, more efficient way to handle the invoice flow on our end. In the meantime, we’re making a few internal adjustments to prevent this from happening again. I’ll keep you updated as things progress.

Regarding sending the payment by check, there’s a short answer and a long answer. The short answer is unfortunately, we can’t accept the check.

The longer answer is that the account issues on our end are taking much longer than expected. The bank keeps telling us the issue is still pending, and we can’t pause business while they sort it out. That’s why, for now, it’s best for us to receive payments through our other active accounts. Trust me, it would be much easier for us too if we could just use our PayNow as usual, but this is the safest and most stable option at the moment.

To make things even easier and if it helps you feel more comfortable, I will share our primary internal account details. This is our main payroll general operating account, not the CITI. It’s the account we use daily, so it’s fully active and secure for receiving payments.

Rest assured, everything is safe on our end, and once the bank resolves the issue, we’ll go back to our normal process. But for now, this is the smoothest and most reliable route.


Regards,



Janet Halstead-Wiggins - CBA

Senior Credit Manager

Good afternoon Janet,

I plan to make another payment by Friday, but I would prefer to wait until your system is functioning correctly. Alternatively, I can email you the check and your team can process it on your end, similar to an ACH, if that is easier.

I was actually about to reach out regarding invoices. Today we received 45 invoices at once, and the system is telling us that the batch is too large to run as a single invoice image. This forces Madelin to manually click through each one, and we simply do not have the bandwidth for that—especially with you being one of our major suppliers.

We really need a more efficient, smoother-running process. Please let me know what options we have to streamline this.

Thank you.

Janet dear,

Let me start by saying that we always aim to close out our November books before moving into December. Madelin and I were accustomed to receiving invoices daily, and maintaining that flow is important. As you know, we do a lot of business, and it isn’t feasible for Madelin to pull these manually from your site every day. One-off situations are fine, of course, but from my understanding, the daily invoices stopped coming toward the end of November.

I need two things:

  1.  Confirmation that we can resume receiving all invoices on a daily basis.

  2.  For today, please assign someone to Madelin so that all November invoices can be sent to us this morning. I cannot close out November without having these entered. I’m fine waiting until the end of the week for any missing December invoices, but November is urgent.

We are still authorized for the payment I mentioned last week, and I will make that a priority—just as you’re making this request a priority for us. I truly appreciate everything you do. I know you work hard to keep us off hold, and I promise that once we get through the year-end, I’ll be back on fire with payments.

Call me if you need anything. I’ll step out of any meeting for you.

> Good afternoon Lori,
>
> We’re aware of the issue with the large batch and we’re already looking
> into a smoother, more efficient way to handle the invoice flow on our end.
> In the meantime, we’re making a few internal adjustments to prevent this
> from happening again. I’ll keep you updated as things progress.
>
> Regarding sending the payment by check, there’s a short answer and a long
> answer. The short answer is unfortunately, we can’t accept the check.
>
> The longer answer is that the account issues on our end are taking much
> longer than expected. The bank keeps telling us the issue is still pending,
> and we can’t pause business while they sort it out. That’s why, for now,
> it’s best for us to receive payments through our other active accounts.
> Trust me, it would be much easier for us too if we could just use our
> PayNow as usual, but this is the safest and most stable option at the
> moment.
>
> To make things even easier and if it helps you feel more comfortable, I
> will share our primary internal account details. This is our main payroll
> general operating account, not the CITI. It’s the account we use daily, so
> it’s fully active and secure for receiving payments.
>
> Rest assured, everything is safe on our end, and once the bank resolves
> the issue, we’ll go back to our normal process. But for now, this is the
> smoothest and most reliable route.

> Janet dear,
>
> Let me start by saying that we always aim to close out our November books
> before moving into December. Madelin and I were accustomed to receiving
> invoices daily, and maintaining that flow is important. As you know, we do *a
> lot* of business, and it isn’t feasible for Madelin to pull these
> manually from your site every day. One-off situations are fine, of course,
> but from my understanding, the daily invoices stopped coming toward the end
> of November.
>
> I need two things:
>
>    1.
>
>    *Confirmation that we can resume receiving all invoices on a daily
>    basis.*
>    2.
>
>    *For today, please assign someone to Madelin so that all November
>    invoices can be sent to us this morning.* I cannot close out November
>    without having these entered. I’m fine waiting until the end of the week
>    for any missing December invoices, but November is urgent.
>
> We are still authorized for the payment I mentioned last week, and I will
> make that a priority—just as you’re making this request a priority for us.
> I truly appreciate everything you do. I know you work hard to keep us off
> hold, and I promise that once we get through the year-end, I’ll be back on
> fire with payments.
>
> Call me if you need anything. I’ll step out of any meeting for you.

Ohhhh Janet, that sounds awful.

Just to be clear — you’re saying it’s best for us to send the ACH directly
from my bank to yours using the information you provided, correct? And once
we send that ACH, we will then send you and your team our remittance along
with the receipt from our bank?

I just want to make sure I fully understand so we’re all on the same page
by Friday.

You’ve been in my thoughts. We definitely need to have lunch soon — after
the dust settles, of course!

On Wed, Dec 10, 2025 at 12:13 PM Janet Halstead- Wiggins <
jhalstead-wiggins@ssdhvca.com> wrote:

> Good afternoon Lori,
>
> We’re aware of the issue with the large batch and we’re already looking
> into a smoother, more efficient way to handle the invoice flow on our end.
> In the meantime, we’re making a few internal adjustments to prevent this
> from happening again. I’ll keep you updated as things progress.
>
> Regarding sending the payment by check, there’s a short answer and a long
> answer. The short answer is unfortunately, we can’t accept the check.
>
> The longer answer is that the account issues on our end are taking much
> longer than expected. The bank keeps telling us the issue is still pending,
> and we can’t pause business while they sort it out. That’s why, for now,
> it’s best for us to receive payments through our other active accounts.
> Trust me, it would be much easier for us too if we could just use our
> PayNow as usual, but this is the safest and most stable option at the
> moment.
>
> To make things even easier and if it helps you feel more comfortable, I
> will share our primary internal account details. This is our main payroll
> general operating account, not the CITI. It’s the account we use daily, so
> it’s fully active and secure for receiving payments.
>
> Rest assured, everything is safe on our end, and once the bank resolves
> the issue, we’ll go back to our normal process. But for now, this is the
> smoothest and most reliable route.
>
> *Regards,*
>

>
> New Online Payment Option: PayNOW — Fast, Secure, and Convenient
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
> Dear Valued Customer,
>
>
>
> For your convenience and continued service value, *Standard Supply* is
> pleased to announce the launch of our new *PayNOW Online Payment Network*,
> effective *November 24, 2025*.
>
>
>
> You can access *PayNOW *by visiting our website at *www.ssdhvac.com
> <http://www.ssdhvac.com/>* and clicking the *“PayNOW”* button/icon. All
> you need is your SSD Account Number. Paying online is *fast, secure, and
> available 24/7* from your smartphone, tablet, or computer — giving you
> complete flexibility in managing your account and invoices.
>
>
>
>
>
> *Payment Options Available:*
>
>
>
> You will have three (3) electronic payment options to choose from when
> paying your invoices:
>
>
>
>    1. ACH/eCheck (electronic check)
>    2. Debit Card
>    3. Credit Card
>
>
>
> *No Fee Options:* There is *no additional fee* when paying by *ACH/eCheck*
>  or* Debit Card*.
>
>
>
> *Credit Card Surcharge:* Beginning *November 24, 2025*, a *3.00%
> surcharge* will apply to all credit card payments. This surcharge helps
> offset the rising processing costs set by Visa, MasterCard, Discover, and
> American Express, allowing us to keep overall costs low for all customers.
>
>
>
> If you’d like to avoid the surcharge, simply select *ACH/eCheck or Debit
> Card *when making your payment through PayNOW.
>
>
>
>
>
> *Why You’ll Love PayNOW*
>
>
>
>    - *Pay anytime, anywhere* — no need to mail checks or call the office.
>    - *Instant confirmation* and faster payment posting.
>    - *Simplified recordkeeping* with digital receipts.
>    - *Secure transactions* using encrypted, bank-grade technology.
>
>
>
> With PayNOW, you can eliminate the time and cost of sending paper checks
> or managing traditional bank ACH payments — all while enjoying a smoother,
> more efficient billing experience.
>
>
>
>
>
> *Questions?*
>
>
>
> We’re here to help! Please contact *Rick De La Fuente* at *214-379-6847* or
> *rdelafuente@ssdhvac.com <rdelafuente@ssdhvac.com> *with any questions
> about PayNOW or payment options.

>
>

> even greater convenience and value as your trusted distributor of choice.

> New Online Payment Option: PayNOW — Fast, Secure, and Convenient
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
> Dear Valued Customer,
>
>
>
> For your convenience and continued service value, *Standard Supply* is
> pleased to announce the launch of our new *PayNOW Online Payment Network*,
> effective *November 24, 2025*.
>
>
>
> You can access *PayNOW *by visiting our website at *www.ssdhvac.com
> <http://www.ssdhvac.com/>* and clicking the *“PayNOW”* button/icon. All
> you need is your SSD Account Number. Paying online is *fast, secure, and
> available 24/7* from your smartphone, tablet, or computer — giving you
> complete flexibility in managing your account and invoices.
>
>
>
>
>
> *Payment Options Available:*
>
>
>
> You will have three (3) electronic payment options to choose from when
> paying your invoices:
>
>
>
>    1. ACH/eCheck (electronic check)
>    2. Debit Card
>    3. Credit Card
>
>
>
> *No Fee Options:* There is *no additional fee* when paying by *ACH/eCheck*
>  or* Debit Card*.
>
>
>
> *Credit Card Surcharge:* Beginning *November 24, 2025*, a *3.00%
> surcharge* will apply to all credit card payments. This surcharge helps
> offset the rising processing costs set by Visa, MasterCard, Discover, and
> American Express, allowing us to keep overall costs low for all customers.
>
>
>
> If you’d like to avoid the surcharge, simply select *ACH/eCheck or Debit
> Card *when making your payment through PayNOW.
>
>
>
>
>
> *Why You’ll Love PayNOW*
>
>
>
>    - *Pay anytime, anywhere* — no need to mail checks or call the office.
>    - *Instant confirmation* and faster payment posting.
>    - *Simplified recordkeeping* with digital receipts.
>    - *Secure transactions* using encrypted, bank-grade technology.
>
>
>
> With PayNOW, you can eliminate the time and cost of sending paper checks
> or managing traditional bank ACH payments — all while enjoying a smoother,
> more efficient billing experience.
>
>
>

Good afternoon Lori,

We’re aware of the issue with the large batch and we’re already looking into a smoother, more efficient way to handle the invoice flow on our end. In the meantime, we’re making a few internal adjustments to prevent this from happening again. I’ll keep you updated as things progress.

The longer answer is that the account issues on our end are taking much longer than expected. The bank keeps telling us the issue is still pending, and we can’t pause business while they sort it out. That’s why, for now, it’s best for us to receive payments through our other active accounts. Trust me, it would be much easier for us too if we could just use our PayNow as usual, but this is the safest and most stable option at the moment.

To make things even easier and if it helps you feel more comfortable, I will share our primary internal account details. This is our main payroll general operating account, not the CITI. It’s the account we use daily, so it’s fully active and secure for receiving payments.

Janet dear,

Let me start by saying that we always aim to close out our November books before moving into December. Madelin and I were accustomed to receiving invoices daily, and maintaining that flow is important. As you know, we do a lot of business, and it isn’t feasible for Madelin to pull these manually from your site every day. One-off situations are fine, of course, but from my understanding, the daily invoices stopped coming toward the end of November.

I need two things:

  1.  Confirmation that we can resume receiving all invoices on a daily basis.

  2.  For today, please assign someone to Madelin so that all November invoices can be sent to us this morning. I cannot close out November without having these entered. I’m fine waiting until the end of the week for any missing December invoices, but November is urgent.

We are still authorized for the payment I mentioned last week, and I will make that a priority—just as you’re making this request a priority for us. I truly appreciate everything you do. I know you work hard to keep us off hold, and I promise that once we get through the year-end, I’ll be back on fire with payments.

Call me if you need anything. I’ll step out of any meeting for you.

Good afternoon Lori,

We’re aware of the issue with the large batch and we’re already looking into a smoother, more efficient way to handle the invoice flow on our end. In the meantime, we’re making a few internal adjustments to prevent this from happening again. I’ll keep you updated as things progress.

Regarding sending the payment by check, there’s a short answer and a long answer. The short answer is unfortunately, we can’t accept the check.

The longer answer is that the account issues on our end are taking much longer than expected. The bank keeps telling us the issue is still pending, and we can’t pause business while they sort it out. That’s why, for now, it’s best for us to receive payments through our other active accounts. Trust me, it would be much easier for us too if we could just use our PayNow as usual, but this is the safest and most stable option at the moment.

To make things even easier and if it helps you feel more comfortable, I will share our primary internal account details. This is our main payroll general operating account, not the CITI. It’s the account we use daily, so it’s fully active and secure for receiving payments.

Rest assured, everything is safe on our end, and once the bank resolves the issue, we’ll go back to our normal process. But for now, this is the smoothest and most reliable route.

Let me start by saying that we always aim to close out our November books before moving into December. I need two things:

  1.  Confirmation that we can resume receiving all invoices on a daily basis.

EMAIL BODY
============================================================
Good afternoon Lori,

We’re aware of the issue with the large batch and we’re already looking into a smoother, more efficient way to handle the invoice flow on our end. In the meantime, we’re making a few internal adjustments to prevent this from happening again. I’ll keep you updated as things progress.

Regarding sending the payment by check, there’s a short answer and a long answer. The short answer is unfortunately, we can’t accept the check.

The longer answer is that the account issues on our end are taking much longer than expected. The bank keeps telling us the issue is still pending, and we can’t pause business while they sort it out. That’s why, for now, it’s best for us to receive payments through our other active accounts. Trust me, it would be much easier for us too if we could just use our PayNow as usual, but this is the safest and most stable option at the moment.

To make things even easier and if it helps you feel more comfortable, I will share our primary internal account details. This is our main payroll general operating account, not the CITI. It’s the account we use daily, so it’s fully active and secure for receiving payments.

Rest assured, everything is safe on our end, and once the bank resolves the issue, we’ll go back to our normal process. But for now, this is the smoothest and most reliable route.


Regards,



Janet Halstead-Wiggins - CBA

Senior Credit Manager

Good afternoon Janet,

I plan to make another payment by Friday, but I would prefer to wait until your system is functioning correctly. Alternatively, I can email you the check and your team can process it on your end, similar to an ACH, if that is easier.

I was actually about to reach out regarding invoices. Today we received 45 invoices at once, and the system is telling us that the batch is too large to run as a single invoice image. This forces Madelin to manually click through each one, and we simply do not have the bandwidth for that—especially with you being one of our major suppliers.

We really need a more efficient, smoother-running process. Please let me know what options we have to streamline this.

Thank you.

Janet dear,

Let me start by saying that we always aim to close out our November books before moving into December. Madelin and I were accustomed to receiving invoices daily, and maintaining that flow is important. As you know, we do a lot of business, and it isn’t feasible for Madelin to pull these manually from your site every day. One-off situations are fine, of course, but from my understanding, the daily invoices stopped coming toward the end of November.

I need two things:

  1.  Confirmation that we can resume receiving all invoices on a daily basis.

  2.  For today, please assign someone to Madelin so that all November invoices can be sent to us this morning. I cannot close out November without having these entered. I’m fine waiting until the end of the week for any missing December invoices, but November is urgent.

We are still authorized for the payment I mentioned last week, and I will make that a priority—just as you’re making this request a priority for us. I truly appreciate everything you do. I know you work hard to keep us off hold, and I promise that once we get through the year-end, I’ll be back on fire with payments.

Call me if you need anything. I’ll step out of any meeting for you.

Janet dear,

Let me start by saying that we always aim to close out our November books before moving into December. Madelin and I were accustomed to receiving invoices daily, and maintaining that flow is important. As you know, we do a lot of business, and it isn’t feasible for Madelin to pull these manually from your site every day. One-off situations are fine, of course, but from my understanding, the daily invoices stopped coming toward the end of November.

I need two things:

  1.  Confirmation that we can resume receiving all invoices on a daily basis.

  2.  For today, please assign someone to Madelin so that all November invoices can be sent to us this morning. I cannot close out November without having these entered. I’m fine waiting until the end of the week for any missing December invoices, but November is urgent.

We are still authorized for the payment I mentioned last week, and I will make that a priority—just as you’re making this request a priority for us. I truly appreciate everything you do. Call me if you need anything. I’ll step out of any meeting for you.

Janet dear,

Let me start by saying that we always aim to close out our November books before moving into December. Madelin and I were accustomed to receiving invoices daily, and maintaining that flow is important. As you know, we do a lot of business, and it isn’t feasible for Madelin to pull these manually from your site every day. One-off situations are fine, of course, but from my understanding, the daily invoices stopped coming toward the end of November.

I need two things:

  1.  Confirmation that we can resume receiving all invoices on a daily basis.

  2.  For today, please assign someone to Madelin so that all November invoices can be sent to us this morning. I cannot close out November without having these entered. I’m fine waiting until the end of the week for any missing December invoices, but November is urgent.

We are still authorized for the payment I mentioned last week, and I will make that a priority—just as you’re making this request a priority for us. I truly appreciate everything you do. I know you work hard to keep us off hold, and I promise that once we get through the year-end, I’ll be back on fire with payments.

Call me if you need anything. I’ll step out of any meeting for you.

Hi Lori,

I understand how important it is for you and Madelin to have those invoices on a consistent daily basis. I’ve already taken steps on my end to ensure that the daily invoice delivery resumes as normal moving forward.

You can also use the Unified/Pay Now portal anytime to view or download your open invoices. Logging into the Standard Supply portal with your customer ID will bring everything up in PDF format if you need something quickly.

And since you mentioned that the payment discussed last week will be paid today. Could you please share the payment receipt as soon as you make the ACH payment to our new details attached? as we are still experiencing issues with our bank linked to our PAYNOW.


Regards,



Janet Halstead-Wiggins - CBA

Senior Credit Manager

Janet dear,

Let me start by saying that we always aim to close out our November books before moving into December. Madelin and I were accustomed to receiving invoices daily, and maintaining that flow is important. As you know, we do a lot of business, and it isn’t feasible for Madelin to pull these manually from your site every day. One-off situations are fine, of course, but from my understanding, the daily invoices stopped coming toward the end of November.

I need two things:

  1.  Confirmation that we can resume receiving all invoices on a daily basis.

  2.  For today, please assign someone to Madelin so that all November invoices can be sent to us this morning. I cannot close out November without having these entered. I’m fine waiting until the end of the week for any missing December invoices, but November is urgent.

We are still authorized for the payment I mentioned last week, and I will make that a priority—just as you’re making this request a priority for us. I truly appreciate everything you do. I know you work hard to keep us off hold, and I promise that once we get through the year-end, I’ll be back on fire with payments.

Call me if you need anything. I’ll step out of any meeting for you.

*******************************COMPANY UPDATE*****************************



New Online Payment Option: PayNOW — Fast, Secure, and Convenient



 



[https://files.constantcontact.com/6eb40698001/e8f4dda1-f9ea-4625-88f8-c59f43666504.jpg?rdr=true]



 



 

Dear Valued Customer,



For your convenience and continued service value, Standard Supply is pleased to announce the launch of our new PayNOW Online Payment Network, effective November 24, 2025.



You can access PayNOW by visiting our website at www.ssdhvac.com<http://www.ssdhvac.com/> and clicking the “PayNOW” button/icon. All you need is your SSD Account Number. Paying online is fast, secure, and available 24/7 from your smartphone, tablet, or computer — giving you complete flexibility in managing your account and invoices.







Payment Options Available:



You will have three (3) electronic payment options to choose from when paying your invoices:



  1.  ACH/eCheck (electronic check)
  2.  Debit Card
  3.  Credit Card



No Fee Options: There is no additional fee when paying by ACH/eCheck or Debit Card.



Credit Card Surcharge: Beginning November 24, 2025, a 3.00% surcharge will apply to all credit card payments. This surcharge helps offset the rising processing costs set by Visa, MasterCard, Discover, and American Express, allowing us to keep overall costs low for all customers.



If you’d like to avoid the surcharge, simply select ACH/eCheck or Debit Card when making your payment through PayNOW.







Why You’ll Love PayNOW



  *   Pay anytime, anywhere — no need to mail checks or call the office.
  *   Instant confirmation and faster payment posting.
  *   Simplified recordkeeping with digital receipts.
  *   Secure transactions using encrypted, bank-grade technology.



With PayNOW, you can eliminate the time and cost of sending paper checks or managing traditional bank ACH payments — all while enjoying a smoother, more efficient billing experience.







Questions?



We’re here to help! Please contact Rick De La Fuente at 214-379-6847 or rdelafuente@ssdhvac.com<mailto:rdelafuente@ssdhvac.com> with any questions about PayNOW or payment options.



Thank you for your continued partnership. We look forward to delivering even greater convenience and value as your trusted distributor of choice.







Kind regards,



Rick De La Fuente

rdelafuente@ssdhvac.com<mailto:rdelafuente@ssdhvac.com>
